thread.title: NIU aims to get back to winning ways at home
thread.title_full: NIU aims to get back to winning ways at home

author: Jay Taft
title: NIU aims to get back to winning ways at home
text: NIU aims to get back to winning ways at home Comment Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 5:03 PM Updated at 5:03 PM Follow @@jaytaft Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 5:03 PM DEKALB — The Northern Illinois Huskies return home Saturday after a rough three-game road trip, and they sound anxious to get back to their winning ways. "I'd say there's more of a sense of urgency around here," NIU wide receiver TommyLee Lewis. "For sure." The program with more wins than any other in Illinois over the past decade — and more wins than all but three teams in the nation since 2010 — dropped three in a row for the first time since the end of the 2009 season, and the defending Mid-American Conference champs are winless in league play headed into Saturday's home game against Ball State. "I don’t think there’s a person in the program that isn’t feeling that," NIU coach Rod Carey said. "But our guys have gotten back to work." NIU (2-3, 0-1 MAC) battled in tough losses to national-powers Ohio State (20-13) and Boston College (17-14), but were then manhandled in last week's MAC opener 29-19 by Central Michigan. Ball State (2-3, 0-1) is in a similar situation, entering Saturday's matchup — known as the the Battle for the Bronze Stalk — on a three-game losing skid. "Behind that whole thing is disappointment, upset, whatever word you want to attach to it," Carey said. "Both teams are going to feel that." Ball State is now being led by freshman quarterback Riley Neal, who has 740 yards passing with four touchdowns and no interceptions. The 6-foot-5, 217-pounder also has 217 yards rushing with a TD. NIU doesn't intend on making wholesale changes to try and stop him, however. They'll still to what they do well. "We're still the same team here," cornerback Paris Logan said. "Things happen. It's just up to us to change it right now." Jay Taft: 815-987-1384; jtaft@rrstar.com ; @JayTaft
